tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 袁邪本王（おざほのおおきみ、生没年不詳）は日本神話に登場する皇族。
sen.e: Ozaho no okimi (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial family, who appears in the Japanese Myth.
Ozaho no okimi (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial family, who appears in the Japanese Myth.
Ozaho no okimi (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial family, who appears in the Japanese Myth.

sen.j: 彦坐王第二王子で、開化天皇の孫に当たる。
sen.e: He was the second prince of Hikoimasu no miko, and a grandchild of the Emperor Kaika.
He was the second prince of Hikoimasu no miko, and a grandchild of the Emperor Kaika.
He was the second prince of Hikoimasu no miko, and a grandchild of the Emperor Kaika.

sen.j: 葛野別・近淡海蚊野別の祖。
sen.e: He is an ancestor of Kadononowake and Chikatsuomi Kanunowake clans.
He is an ancestor of the Kadononowake and Chikatsuomi Kanunowake clans.
sen.cmt: an ancester of theとしました。
sen.e: He is an ancestor of the Kadononowake and Chikatsuomi Kanunowake clans.

sen.j: 母は春日建国勝戸売（戸売とあることから女性であることが分かるが、父は明らかではない）の娘沙本之大闇見戸売（さほのおおくらみとめ）。
sen.e: His mother was Sahonookura mitome, a daughter of Kasugatatekuni katsutome (from the name ending with "tome", we can see this is a woman; however, father of Sahonookura mitome is unknown).
His mother was Sahonookura mitome, a daughter of Kasugatatekuni katsutome (from the name ending with "tome," we can see this is a woman; however, father of Sahonookura mitome is unknown).
sen.cmt: 全角クォーテーションを半角に修正、カンマの位置を移動
sen.e: His mother was Sahonookura mitome, a daughter of Kasugatatekuni katsutome (from the name ending with "tome," we can see this is a woman; however, father of Sahonookura mitome is unknown).

sen.j: 同母の兄弟に日下部連・甲斐国造の祖狭穂彦王、若狭耳別の祖室毘古王と垂仁天皇皇后狭穂姫命がいる。
sen.e: He had three maternal half-brothers and sisters: Sahohiko no miko, an ancestor of Kusakabe no muraji and Kai no kuni no miyatsuko clans; Murobiko no miko, an ancestor of Wakasa no mimi no wake clan; and Sahohime no mikoto, an empress to the Emperor Suinin.

He had three maternal half-brothers and sisters: Sahohiko no miko, an ancestor of the Kusakabe no muraji and Kai no kuni no miyatsuko clans; Murobiko no miko, an ancestor of the Wakasa no mimi no wake clan; and Sahohime no mikoto, an empress to the Emperor Suinin.
sen.cmt: an ancester of theとしました。
sen.e: He had three maternal half-brothers and sisters: Sahohiko no miko, an ancestor of the Kusakabe no muraji and Kai no kuni no miyatsuko clans; Murobiko no miko, an ancestor of the Wakasa no mimi no wake clan; and Sahohime no mikoto, an empress to the Emperor Suinin.

sen.j: 王は父の彦坐王と共に滋賀県愛知郡 (滋賀県)秦荘町・軽野神社の祭神となっている。
sen.e: Together with his father Hikoimasu no miko, Ozaho no okimi is enshrined as a deity at Karuno-jinja Shrine located in Hatasho-cho, Echi-gun, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処；秦荘町は現在愛荘町（あいしょうちょう）になっていますが、現状は原稿通りに訳しています。
sen.e: Together with his father Hikoimasu no miko, Ozaho no okimi is enshrined as a deity at Karuno-jinja Shrine located in Hatasho-cho, Echi County, Shiga Prefecture.
Together with his father Hikoimasu no miko, Ozaho no okimi is enshrined as a deity at Karuno-jinja Shrine located in Hatasho-cho, Echi County, Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: その他、滋賀県伊香郡木之本町・佐波加刀神社の祭神に名を連ねている。
sen.e: He is also included in deities enshrined at Sawakato-jinja Shrine located in Kinomoto-cho, Ika-gun, Shiga Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処；滋賀県伊香郡木之本町は現在滋賀県長浜市になっており、ウェブ上もその表記になっていますが、現状は原稿通りに訳しています。
sen.e: He is also included in deities enshrined at Sawakato-jinja Shrine located in Kinomoto-cho, Ika County, Shiga Prefecture.
He is also included in deities enshrined at Sawakato-jinja Shrine located in Kinomoto-cho, Ika County, Shiga Prefecture.
